description.value:
Trigger A creature defies the prison's authority (such as by attacking a clockwork soldier or living graffiti)

Effect The mural commands the inmate to cease their defiance and surrender to authority. All living creatures in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 1} on a failure, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure. The trap then rolls initiative.

details.description: A magical mural threatens uncooperative inmates, causing mental trauma.
details.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:26] (expert) to deactivate the mural, or @Check[arcana|dc:26] (trained) to disrupt the mural's magic, or @Check[deception|dc:24] (trained) to pose as a superior and order the mural to deactivate, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (3rd rank; counteract DC 24) to counteract the mural

publication.title: Pathfinder #215: To Blot Out the Sun

details.routine: (1 action) On its turn, the trap threatens all living creatures in the room, dealing @Damage[(3d6+5)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:22|basic] save).
